review_title: Register within 30 days to get your warranty!
review_thoughts: I wasn't totally sure how to rate this. I'm a firm believer in red light therapy. I've used a LightStim for years and it has helped to keep my skin looking young and plump. I'm 35 and people can't believe I'm over 22. I also use it on bruises and it helps them heal faster. I bought this mask a couple months ago and then it stopped charging. I used different chargers and adapters to make sure it wasn't the cord that came with it that was faulty. It just completely stopped. I went to the Dr. Dennis Gross website to look at warranty information and was surprised to find out that the 1-year warranty is only good if you register your product within 30 days of purchasing the product. Thankfully, dermstore has a 60 day exhange policy. I was able to return this for a new one which I promptly registered on the Dr. Dennis Gross website. Hopefully, the first mask that stopped working was a fluke. Despite that, this product is comfortable and makes my red light therapy sessions much faster. With my beloved Lightstim (I've had it for over 5 years!), it would take about 30 minutes to do my whole face because I had to do section by section 3 minutes at a time. Because of its time-consuming nature, I would skip a lot of nights just because I didn't have the time. With this mask, I never miss a night because it's so quick and my whole face is treated in 3 minutes. I'd give the mask 3 stars for build quality, but 5 for efficacy and ease of use. And Dermstore gets 5 stars for their awesome service.

review_title: Not seen much improvement to boast about
review_thoughts: I have had this product for over 8 months now. So if there was going to be nay improvement, it would have happened by now. I used it almost every day except for maybe fr a handful of days that I skipped it. I don't think I have noticed much difference. Maybe my acne is reduced by I still get them. Wrinkles around the eyes are still there, skin texture is so so. Neither the dark spots nor the acne scars have gone lighter or have looked better than before. The lights are upper bright so I actually cover my eyes with small eye patches to protect my vision. I made sure these patches didn't cover the skin under my eye or around the eye so that I would get the benefit of these led lights. The band to keep it around the head is very flimsy and comes off so I had to add my own elastic to it to keep it in place. How effective has it been? I have gotten two Sculptra treatments in my face and the RN suggested I do a third vile which I am debating on. Also I am scheduled for a lighter laser treatment for my face. That is how useless this device has been. At some point we should stop buying these gimmicky devices that promise everything and delivery very little.

review_title: Helpful with redness and hormonal acne
review_thoughts: I've been using this product for about 6 weeks now. I bought it to help with hormonal breakouts and redness associated with rosacea (although I could certainly use the help with fine lines as well.) The mask is very sturdy and easy to use although the strap isn't quite as well designed as the mask itself - it almost seems like it was as an afterthought. I've been using it for 2 weeks and all of my dry spots have cleared up and I've had no breakouts, so I'll probably continue to use. I only use 4 drops and it sits on top of my skin/doesn't absorb well, so I only use it before bed. I'm not sure that it would sit well under makeup if that's your intention.

review_thoughts: I'm not sure why, but I like using oils for hydration. I have tried Acure 100% marula oil, which is nice but doesn't seem to soak in as much as I'd like; Josie Maran's original and light argan oils, pretty nice; Laura Mercier's infusion de rose nourishing oil, which is truly lovely; and then this Indie Lee squalane, which is truly great. It has been getting a lot of love on Instagram, and I don't always buy in to hype, but something about this really grabbed me. review_thoughts: Was very surprised how harsh this cleanser is, considering it’s from LRP and is marketed for sensitive skin. It’s VERY soapy, foamy and heavily fragranced. After using it for a few days my normal but slightly sensitive skin started peeling and it took weeks of rehab to calm it back down. I know the cleanser was the culprit, as it was the only change to my routine. LHA is a type of salicylic acid, so I would avoid using it unless you have strong skin that tends to be oily. I would also avoid using it on days when you apply a retinol/retinoid. It’s very drying and requires a good moisturizer afterward.

review_title: Great value for a salicylic acid product
review_thoughts: Bought this product for husband who has Rosacea and needed a salicylic acid cleanser. I like how large the bottle is because this will last a while. The dispenser top to the bottle is great too - easy to pump and dispenses just the right amount to work into your face. The only other thing I wish about the bottle itself is that it was recyclable in my area - too many of these beauty products are in throw in the garbage bottles and jars which is a major disappointment during these times. The product itself has no scent and is more of a lotion in consistency than a liquid, like another salicylic acid product I had tried and because of the liquid nature and squeeze tube that held it, caused leakage. Goes on smoothly and is non irritating to husband's sensitive skin. Does take another cleanser afterwards to clean off the product. Overall, we are both pleased with this product and would buy again. Great value for the amount received.

review_title: Not as good as I thought it would be
review_thoughts: I was so excited to get this, but after using it, it's not as good as I thought it would be. First off, I wish it had a nice drawstring bag to put it in so it doesn't scratch up my drawer or gets scratched up itself. The box that it comes in is extremely secure but it's extremely difficult to get it out of the foam that it is sitting in, it was really hard to get it out to where it almost flew out of the box onto the floor, thankfully that didn't happen and I caught it. I did try to just lay it on top of the foam but it keeps getting stuck into the cutout portion of it and it's still very difficult to get out..that's why there's a need for a nice drawstring bag to keep it in. Secondly, I do like that it seems to stay cold and contour and de-puff my face, but I don't seem to see the results that I see with other facial massagers . I would not refer it to my friends because I think there are more effective products out there, but I still like it enough to keep it just for the cooling affect under my eyes and because it feels like an aesthetician's massage when I use it on my forehead, other than that it doesn't seem to do as good of a job.

review_title: One of my favorite purchases- I've been loving it for a whole year!
review_thoughts: I have had the Nurse Jamie Instant UpLift for a whole year now and I still love it as much as I did when I first received it. I feel like you definitely need to use it consistently to see the best results as with most things but even using it every now and then it's a really nice tool. I keep my Nurse Jamie Instant UpLift in the freezer in in a ziplock bag. I santitize it often with a cotton pad that is damp with rubbing alcohol... I don't pour rubbing alcohol directly on the tool. I looked online for cleansing information and found somewhere that said not to soak the tool itself with anything. I'll let the tool sit out for a couple minutes to "dry" but it's pretty much instantly dry because the cotton pad is only damp, not soaked. What I like most about this tool (besides how heavenly the massage feels) is how versatile it is. I have used this before cleansing my face, after cleansing my face, before applying makeup, to work serums in, on top of sheet masks (for the whole 30 minutes I keep the mask on!), and after removing sheet masks to soak in all of that extra goodness that's leftover. I do prefer to use the tool with some sort of product vs just dry on my face but that's only because I feel like it rolls a lot easier with a little lubrication. My esthetician also said she prefers I use it with a product vs dry. I use this tool ALL over my face and sometimes on my body too. Forehead, neck, lips, chest, arms... everywhere! I feel like right after using this tool my skincare products soak in a lot nicer and my skin does look plump. After using this consistently for about a month my esthetician asked me what I was doing different. According to her my skin looked a lot smoother. I think this tool is worth the splurge. It's not a miracle maker by any means and it won't save your skin on it's own but it's a nice little product to have in your skincare routine. *The MOST important thing is to always remember to roll UP- and be gentle! Do not tug or pull on the skin. You can find plenty of videos on YouTube showing you how to use this properly.*

review_thoughts: I regret the moment I decided to order this product. Saw on a home shopping channel and found best price here. When I started using it I noticed the skin turning reddish but thought it was simply the increased blood supply. WRONG - it triggered a full blown rosacea like issue. Face turned blood red, upper eye lids turned red inner rim of lower lid and swollen. Apparently this tool triggered the issue and resulted in constant swollen red face, eyes and due to the irritation from the metal caused my eye glands to start blocking. Derm tried me on rosacea cream and it didn't work at all, had to go to the eye doctor and all sorts of medication to attempt to help with the eye situation. I am still in the process of recovering from all the effects of this tool. I strongly suggest everyone be very careful using anything that is metal on the face and especially around the eye area. Wish I had never purchased this

review_title: A wonderful product when used consistently
review_thoughts: I watch Tati (AKA - Glamlifeguru) on YouTube and she raves about this product. After debating for a few months I decided to give it a try. I keep this in it's box in a drawer in my bathroom, which keeps it very cool. Rolling it on my face after applying my serum or moisturizer really does feel luxurious, like a spa treatment. I use this all over my body though, not just my face. I suffer from the bat wing problem no matter how much yoga or how many dips I do. Using this consistently once a day I have seen improvement in that area. I stopped using it there for a week to see if maybe it was just in my head, but the improvements went away when I stopped. This isn't an instant fix by any means, but I've seen improvement in the puffiness in my face, neck and arms when using this daily. I recommend it, even if just for the spa treatment feeling.

review_title: meh... but I think I still like it.
review_thoughts: I bought this after seeing it on YouTube (probably the same place one of the other reviewers saw it)... then I saw these reviews, and I really wanted to believe. I rolled it around a bit (in accordance to the instructions 30-45 seconds per area), and it does not work at all for me. No lift, no depuffing, no miracles. review_thoughts: Slippery!  The nifty little scoop helps but still scoops out more than one eye gel at a time. I do like that there is less waste in packaging with one container instead of individual packets.  I am a huge fan of Skyn Iceland gel patches, but definitely pricey so have wanted to try these for a while.  I was intrigued about being able to wear them all night.  I really want to get rid of my puffy bags from habitual lack of sleep.  That part is tricky because they slide around.  I ended up putting my eye make over them to try to keep them in place.  I admit to be a little nervous because I have sensitive skin and wasn't sure if I'd wake up with a red rash.  Good news:  no problems!   They were  dried up in the morning and maybe did help decrease puffiness, slight crease where they shriveled.  Overall, not a bad alternative to Skyn for a more frequent use; saving my Skyn patches for special events.

Minor packaging quirk: A little bit of product always seems to clump at the pump, so I have to get the little clumped amount off before each application. review_title: Love this product. Don't love the price of it or the bottle type packaging
review_thoughts: I received this serum from Jane Iredale and Influenster for free in place of doing this honest review. I love hyaluronic acid products because of the intense moisture it brings to the skin almost immediately and the fine and deep line plumping from the moisture it gives the skin. Hyaluronic acids molecular make up allows it to absorb into deep layers of the skin unlike so many other products that just sit on top of the skin. If products aren't able to be absorbed then they just sit on top of the skin as a semi protective layer that really doesn't do much good for us. It does not clog pores and is so easy to incorporate into any skin care regimen. It has a light scent that fades and it absorbs so nicely. I've been mixing this with my retinol serum so the retinal is absorbed better without irritation. I'd purchase this again if I had a hefty coupon since it comes out to $52 at regular price. I think this is such a simply made product that shouldn't be used long term alone since you need peptides and other types of moisture as well so that's why I don't think it should be priced so highly but that's just my opinion. I'm on the oily side and can have bad break outs, uneven skin tone and sensitive skin every now-and-then because of that. This does not make me any more oily. I'm not a fan of the squirt bottle type of packaging since there's no way to use the last few uses out of it unless you open it up and shake it out which is ridiculous since it's not a cheap product. I docked 2 stars because of price and because of the functionality of the bottle it comes in. I definitely recommend this to anyone who needs lightweight moisture for any reason and to plump up fine and deep lines over time.

review_thoughts: I received a sample size of this product in my monthly Beautyfix box. I have had it for a while, but hadn't used it due to the description on pamphlet- it made it sound like the product was supposed to be used post-procedure. I go to my derm every few months for a microderm and recently had a few dark spots lasered away. After this procedure my skin was much more sensitive than normal. I tried this cream on it and WOW. My sensitivity disappeared. I kept using it for a few days and was very pleased with the result. My skin was bright (bear in mind I just had a microderm) and clear. No purging after my procedure and the dark spots from the laser just disappeared, they did not flake as they normally do. The texture of this cream is a little different than what I normally use on my face. It's a thicker consistency, think Vaseline, but melts into your skin nicely. A little goes a long way, so my sample should be enough to get me though a few more treatments. I'm not sure that the way I used the product was the appropriate way, but I was pleased with the result and plan to repurchase for use after treatments.

review_title: very interesting product, great so far
review_thoughts: I got this product during the Dermstore sale because I saw a dermatologist online describe the benefits of BHA's and how they are compatible with sensitive skin and can be used with retinol. I was disappointed at how small the product was. I overlooked that it is 1.4oz, the size of a travel shampoo! Regardless, I am very pleased with the product so far. The texture is unique, it feels almost like petroleum jelly at first, and then it melts down into a smooth spreadable satin lotion. I think this is due to the silicones in there. My skin has been very sensitive since I started using retinol and I have hormonal acne. Most lotions break me out, even crave, and I have to be very choosy with my products. This doesn't irritate my skin at all and I just love how it feels. I do have a little mild rosacea so I am worried that this will cause redness if I keep on using it but so far everything seems fine. Either way, I would continue to use this on my neck and chest, the texture is just so divine. Now I'm wondering what else neostrata has to offer. I am very impressed so far.

review_thoughts: This is hands down my favorite beauty product! I use it after I've applied my primer on make up days, or I use this right after moisturizer without other face makeup products on top on minimal makeup days. It gives the perfect amount of glow without any sparkle. The Sunny shade perfectly warms up my light/medium skin tone to match the rest of my body, especially in the summertime. I have pretty even skin and few blemishes, so I can use this alone without foundation for a natural, lit from within, medium-tan glow. It actually has good staying power when used alone too. It is pricey, but I only need to use one pump at a time (two pumps if I need some color on my neck too), so one bottle usually lasts me about six months. I've tried to find a cheaper alternative and nothing comes close to this.

review_thoughts: So in love with this brightening serum that I purchased in two different colour, Apricot Glow and Sunny Flash. With medium Asian skin colouration I can never get just the right colour out of any bottle. I mixed the two colour to get the right natural colour. As autumn approaches I found Apricot Glow is good enough to give the right healthy colour reflection. Apricot Glow looks SCARY peach & FAIR for my skin out of the box but once applied it just melt into skin and gives it a natural beautiful glow. A thin application is all that you need. It is very hydrating and a good layering serum underneath a foundation. A little goes along way! No need to over do it. The product is pricey but it work. I sometimes used highlighter but this serum has a different use than highlighter. This serum reflects healthy well taken care off skin glow for all skin surfaces not highlighting certain area of the facial bones. So I sometimes used this serum on its own. If you are looking for a cover or camouflage all skin imperfection - this is not it! The texture is a tad bit thin and runny. I don't see this as a flaw but rather a plus for easy application. I apply it to face with fingers and buff it by patting it in. It has a faint rose scent which at first really bothers me but now I just don't notice them anymore. Overall I'm very happy and will be purchasing another bottle once I ran out of it. Note: Since there is no colour description available here for reference I thought I just share my experience on the two colour choice I owned. In the bottle, Apricot Glow is more gold light peach and looks more suitable for fair skin person but don't judge it yet because it also work for me - stange! The Sunny Glow is more deeper gold bronzy colour good for people with fake tan and obviously ethnic skin colour. Hope this help.

review_thoughts: This was mostly an impulse purchase after seeing a few YouTube/bloggers rave about this serum and the sun kissed glow it provides.
